page.title: 07OLDEST SCHOOL_SKELMERSDALE
page.content:
Crow Orchard C.P School is the oldest school in our town. It dates from 1732 and has been known as "The Endowed School" because it was built with money left in a will by Evan Smith, dated the 8th September 1726.
The first headmaster of the school was Mr. James Eden and the next was the Rev. Richard Aston. No registers were kept until 1877 when a log book was started. The school became very overcrowded at about this time and the conditions were poor. Some of the items in the log book are quite funny:
"John Martland sent to beg pardon for stealing Mr. Berry's slate nails."
"Joseph Birchall sent to beg pardon for annoying people at a funeral."
